member.name: T:ActiveUp.WebControls.ActiveDateTime
member.summary: This server control allows users to select a valid date and/or time trough selectors.

member.summary: Register the client side validation script in the ASP page.

member.remarks: This method notifies the server control to perform any necessary prerendering steps prior to saving view state and rendering content.
member.param: An object that contains the event data.

member.summary: Return the miliraty hour from the specified meridiem hour.

member.summary: This method create a selector based on the parameters.

The value of the OnChange attribute of the selector to use with the client side validator.
The minimum value of the selector.
The maximum value of the selector.
The number of chars to use with padding.

The collection of all incoming name values.

member.summary: Gets or sets the date of the control.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.ActiveDateTime.MinYear
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum year to display in the year selector.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.ActiveDateTime.MaxYear
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum year to display in the year selector.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.ActiveDateTime.AlertEnabled
member.summary: Lets you specify if you want the control to show an alert popup when a invalid date is selected.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.ActiveDateTime.AutoAdjust
member.summary: Set to true is we want to auto adjust the maximum and/or minimum year with the data.
member.remarks: Setting a high value to or setting a low value in can produce performance problem. For each year, more than 20 bytes are added to the browser HTML output. By setting this property to true, you can prevent from exception throws without having to set very high maximum year or very low minimum year. If the maximum year value is less than the actual date year value, the maximum year will be adjusted to the actual date year. Same for the minimum year.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.ActiveDateTime.BaseStyle
member.summary: Gets the style properties of the date and time selectors base.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.ActiveDateTime.DateStyle
member.summary: Gets the style properties of the date selectors.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.ActiveDateTime.Months
member.summary: Gets or sets the month names.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.ActiveDateTime.SetMonthNames
member.summary: Sets the month names.
member.remarks:
This array of string contains the month names. You can set your own month names to match with your culture. If your website is in french, you will prefer use Février in replacment of February. By default, the months are in english. If the property is set to true, numbers will replace month names.
// Please verify that MonthNamesDisabled property is not set to true <AU:ActiveDateTime runat="server" id="CompleteSelector" Format="day;/;month;/;year; ;hour;:;minute;:;second;:;millisecond" SetMonthNames="Janvier,Février,Mars,Avril,Mai,Juin,Juillet,Août,Septembre,Octobre,Novembre,Décembre"></AU:ActiveDateTime>

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.ActiveDateTime.MonthNamesDisabled
member.summary: Specify if you want to display month names or month numbers. False by default.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.ActiveDateTime.TimeStyle
member.summary: Gets the style properties of the time selectors.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.ActiveDateTime.AlertText
member.summary: Gets or sets the alert text to use when a invalid date is selected.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.ActiveDateTime.cssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the css class.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.ActiveDateTime.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the format to use to render the selectors.
member.remarks:
You can specify the display layout using the format specifiers like "hour" or "month".
Fields must be separated by ; (semicolon) char. Non reconized fields are send to the HtmlTextWriter as literal text.
Here are some examples ([ and ] represent a selector:
"month;/;day;/;year" will display
[MONTH]/[DAY]/[YEAR].
"hour;:;minute" will display
[HOUR]:[MINUTE].
"Date : ;day;/;month;/;year; Time : ;hour;:;minute;:;second" will display
Date : [DAY]/[MONTH]/[YEAR] Time : [HOUR]:[MINUTE]:[SECOND].
Format SpecifierName
dayThe day part (1 to 31).
monthThe month part (1 to 12).
yearThe year part (variable).
hourThe hour part (0 to 23).
minuteThe minute part (0 to 59).
secondThe second part (0 to 59).
millisecondThe millisecond part (0 to 999).
other literalRendered as literal text.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.ActiveDateTime.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets then enabled state of the control.
member.remarks: This was added by Todd Davis

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.ActiveDateTime.AllowNull

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.ActiveDateTime.NullString
member.summary: Gets or sets then string (char) to display for the null selection.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.ActiveDateTime.Use24HourFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets value indicating if you want to use the 24h (military) format.
